result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction.

Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 4 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.  

Dates:
RH: 7/6/22 at 1:00p.m Ct. Rm B.
PH: 7/11/22 at 9:50a.m. Ct. Rm B.
CC: 7/6/22 at 1:00p.m.

Branch 3.

ADJ: 2:30p.m.

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 3:02 pm 
INCLUDES 19CF1246, 21CF1075, & 21CF1159. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Robert Forseth. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
In 21CF1075: Cts. 1 & 2>>D&RI. 
In 21CF1159: Ct. 1>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 19CF1246: Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                     : Ct. 2 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
In 21CF1159: Ct. 2 (Lewd, Lascivious Behavior/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 
                     : Ct. 3 (DC/Repeater)>>GUILTY. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty on all, but defers entry of judgment on Ct. 1 in 19CF1246. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 19CF1246: Ct. 1>>DEOJ for 18 months with conditions as outlined in written agreement - if def successfully completes terms of DEOJ, this charge is to be DISMISSED. 

In 19CF1246: Ct. 2 & In 21CF1159: Cts. 2 & 3>>COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation - CONDITIONS: Alcohol assessment; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances/alcohol except prescribed medications used as prescribed and with agent authorization; good faith effort at fulltime employment of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; DNA sample/surcharge (sample already on file); CC. 

COURT finds def entitled to jail credit as follows: 
In 19CF1246: 353 days. 
In 21CF1159: 296 days. 

DEOJ Review set for Dec. 15, 2023 at 10:45 am with Br. 3 JA in 19CF1246. 
Adj: 3:14 pm
